titleStmt.title: W. F. Barren to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2224

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: Mr. A. J. Harrington the secretary of the Pilots Association of this City desires to be made a Notary Public for Jefferson County. I can commend him as a Gentleman he is a member of the city council, and the office will facilitate him in his business of Secry of the Association
From this my recommendation I take it for granted as you have never refused me that you will cause the case to be forwarded and hence I send for Mr Page his $2 -- which please hand him

Most Truly your friend
W. F. Barren
Notary Public
Jefferson Co
A. J. Harrington
apptd
18 Oct/65
